Class MusicPlayer

java.lang.Object
MusicPlayer
public class MusicPlayer extends Object
MusicPlayer class which is responsible for playing/pausing/stopping the music.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Youssef Tarek

    static void
    resumePlayback()
    Resumes the playback of the music from where it left off by first checking that the clip is not equal to null and then sets the position using the Clip.setMicrosecondPosition(long) method and uses the value stored in #pausePosition and then starts the playback by using DataLine.start() and then sets #isPlaying to true.
    static void
    stopPlayback()
    Stops the playback of the music by first checking that the clip is not equal to null and uses the DataLine.stop() method to stop the music and closes the clip completely by using Line.close()

  • Constructor Details

    • MusicPlayer

      public MusicPlayer()

  • Method Details

    • playmusic

      public static void playmusic(String music) throws UnsupportedAudioFileException, IOException, LineUnavailableException

      Takes the music param and creates a new variable of type File called musicFile and stores it in it.

      Then creates a new variable called audioInputStream of type AudioInputStream to get the audio input from musicFile by using the method AudioSystem.getAudioInputStream(URL) from the class AudioSystem.

      Then uses the AudioSystem.getClip() method to get the clip and uses Line.open() method to open audioInputStream variable.

      Then initializes the latch variable.

      Then adds a new LineListener using the Line.addLineListener(LineListener) method to handle when the music stops and then it sets the isPlaying variable to false.

      Then starts playing the music using DataLine.start() method and sets the isPlaying variable true.

      Parameters:
      music - The path to the audio file to be played.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedAudioFileException - If the audio file format is not supported.
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the audio file.
      LineUnavailableException - If a line matching the specified criteria cannot be opened.
      See Also:
      • Clip
      • AudioInputStream
      • AudioSystem
      • File
      • CountDownLatch

    • pausePlayback

      public static void pausePlayback()

      Pauses the music by first checking if the clip is not equal to null and if the music is still playing by using the DataLine.isRunning() method.

      If the condition is true is stores the current position of the song inside of the pausePosition variable using the DataLine.getMicrosecondPosition() and then stops the playback by using the DataLine.stop() method and sets isPlaying to false.

      See Also:
      • Clip

    • stopPlayback

      public static void stopPlayback()

      Stops the playback of the music by first checking that the clip is not equal to null and uses the DataLine.stop() method to stop the music and closes the clip completely by using Line.close()

      See Also:
      • Clip

    • resumePlayback

      public static void resumePlayback()

      Resumes the playback of the music from where it left off by first checking that the clip is not equal to null and then sets the position using the Clip.setMicrosecondPosition(long) method and uses the value stored in #pausePosition and then starts the playback by using DataLine.start() and then sets #isPlaying to true.

      See Also:
      • Clip

    • isPlaying

      public static boolean isPlaying()
      Getter for the isPlaying boolean variable.
      Returns:
      isPlaying
